description: From Malay perau, a variant of perahu. In some forms via Portuguese parão or Dutch prauw; in some forms assimilated to prow.

entries.meaning: A sailing vessel found in the waters of Micronesia and Indonesia; it has a single, large outrigger and a triangular sail.
examples: I noticed that on the sea were numerous fantastically shaped canoes—or rather boats—like Malay proas, or the canoes used by many of the South Sea islanders.
